results.title: Night of the execution. Forty detectives later
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions and Alfred J Hitchcock Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more twisted fables hosted by the master of the macabre. “Night of the execution”: A District Attorney, keen for political success and whose wife is more ambtious than he is, is desperate for a conviction in a murder trial he is prosecuting. So desperate, he is willing to do anything to send the defendant to the chair… anything. “Forty detectives later”: A man who claims he has found his wife’s murderer, hires his forty-first detective to wreak vengeance…

results.title: The Big score. Malice domestic.
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions and Alfred J Hitchcock Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Another two macabre tales hosted by the master. “The Big score”: A deceitful baby-sitter sets up her delinquent friends for a heist of her trusting employer’s money. The evening ends in murder, but who is who in this twisted nightmare? “Malice domestic”: A writer who loves his wife’s cooking is incredulous when his doctor tries to tell him that his wife is trying to kill him. If only his dog could tell him what’s really going on.

results.title: The Door without a key. The Landlady
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions and Alfred J Hitchcock Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more fine tales introduced by the master of the macabre. “The Door without a key”: Uplifting tale of the comings and goings of a police-station late at night. Stars Claude Rains as a man with amnesia and Billy Mumy as a lost little boy. “The Landlady”: A young man arrives in a provincial town in England needing a place to stay. It was strange circumstance that drew the young man to stay at this boarding house, it was an even stranger circumstance that made him a permanent guest. A gentle horror story based on a Roald Dahl short story and adapted by Robert Bloch. Stars Dean Stockwell.

results.title: The Last dark step; Flight to the East
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions and Alfred J Hitchcock Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
The Last dark step: A fatal attraction has a ‘kept’ man unable to get out of a relationship with a disturbed girlfriend and marry a respectable girl. He is willing to do anything to get away, but she is willing to do anything to keep him. “Flight to the East”: When two strangers on a plane to Cairo meet, coincidence becomes too close for comfort for a man wrongly accused.
results.title_for_label: The Last dark step; Flight to the East

results.title: I spy. Total loss
results.creator_credit: Shamley International Productions and Alfred J Hitchcock Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more fine tales from the vault of the master of the macabre. “I spy”: Pompous old Captain Morgan’s wife has up and left him, without so much as a note to let him know where she is. So he has hired private detective, Mr. Fruit to spy on her and see what she’s up to. Mr. Fruit poses as a waiter at the restaurant where she works and waits to see if she has found a gentleman friend… “Total loss”: A widow is left with a clothing business, but her head for business is no match for her sense of style. She is in debt and beginning to get desperate when she is tempted by an insurance scam…
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shamley International Productions and Alfred J Hitchcock Productions

results.title: Alexandria, why? = Iskindiria, leh? [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine and Misr International Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Alexandria Trilogy”.
Set against the panoramic backdrop of war-torn Egypt, director Youssef Chahine tells a highly personal tale of love and determination. Yehia is an eighteen-year-old boy living with extended family in Alexandria. His parents, in particular his father, have made great personal sacrifices in order to send their son to expensive schools, in order that he may become an engineer. But Yehia fosters desires and ambitions to be an actor in Hollywood. Despite Yehia’s evident commitment, his father dismisses his son’s art as a serious prospect. However as Hitler’s troops advance toward Egypt, the life that Yehia and his family are accustomed to starts to crumble. Thousands flee, becoming refugees, and as prices inflate ordinary people struggle to cope with wartime rationing. Meanwhile - a group of men, disgruntled by English occupation dispatch various plots, in the hope of assassinating Churchill; a beautiful Jewess falls in love with one would-be-assassin, but her wealthy father wishes them to flee the Nazi threat; a young gay English soldier, terrified of his imminent dispatch to the Front, has an affair with a charming aristocrat. Chahine cleverly intersperses newsreel footage with the lives of his protagonists as they struggle to determine their prospects, whilst also interrogating notions of patriotism and duty versus desire and personal ambition. This autobiographical film was followed by two sequels, “Alexandria again and forever” and “An Egyptian story”. In Arabic and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Alexandria again and forever
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine, Le Sept, Paris Classics and Misr International Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alexandria Trilogy”.
In this third and final instalment of Youssef Chahine’s “Alexandria” trilogy (preceded by Alexandria, why? and An Egyptian story) Chahine’s protagonist and alter-ego, Yehia, is now an aging filmmaker who laments the state of the Egyptian film industry and joins his colleagues on strike to protest their circumstances. Simultaneously Yehia (played by the director himself) finds himself attracted to two actors - the handsome young Amr, who Yehia works with on laboured productions, and Nadia, with whom he hopes to collaborate. Following on from the themes explored in “An Egyptian story”, Yahia heartlessly forfeits his personal relationships in favour of his work. Yahine’s struggle to reconcile his art with his ambitions and personal failings is set against Egypt’s divisive drive, in the 1980s, toward democratic reform. The film takes on a surreal flavour with several musical interludes (one delightfully recalling “Singin’ in the rain” as Yehia and Amr celebrate winning the Silver Bear award at Berlin). Chahine applies his signature energy to the film - an appealing mix of whimsy, satire and barbed attacks on the political and social situation in his beloved homeland. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: An Egyptian story = Hadota Misreya
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine and Misr International Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Alexandria Trilogy”.
This unusual and fascinating follow-up to “Alexandria, why?” picks up the story of Yehia, the troubled adolescent boy headed for prosperity in America as WWII ravaged his Egyptian homeland. Yehia, now a draconian film director who neglects his wife and children in order to create his work, falls ill and requires open-heart surgery. During the operation a young boy, representing Yehia’s conscience, accuses him of betraying his ideals. A metamorphic trial ensues in which various witnesses, including family and colleagues, offer their testimony about “the defendant”. These proceedings force the filmmaker to come to terms with hidden emotions involving his life, work and country. Chahine’s work examines the politics of the 1952 revolution and its demise in 1967, as well as the frissons that arise as he tries to reconcile his art with his ambitions. This film recalls “Eight and a half” and “All that jazz” in that it examines one man’s conscience and history, in a humoristic, satirical and at times, surrealistic, manner. This sequel was followed up by “Alexandria again and forever”. In Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: Alexandria again and forever [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine, Paris Classics, Misr International Films and La Sept Cinema
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alexandria Trilogy”.
In this third and final instalment of Youssef Chahine’s “Alexandria” trilogy (preceded by Alexandria, why? and An Egyptian story) Chahine’s protagonist and alter-ego, Yehia, is now an aging filmmaker who laments the state of the Egyptian film industry and joins his colleagues on strike to protest their circumstances. Simultaneously Yehia (played by the director himself) finds himself attracted to two actors - the handsome young Amr, who Yehia works with on laboured productions, and Nadia, with whom he hopes to collaborate. Following on from the themes explored in “An Egyptian story”, Yahia heartlessly forfeits his personal relationships in favour of his work. Yahine’s struggle to reconcile his art with his ambitions and personal failings is set against Egypt’s divisive drive, in the 1980s, toward democratic reform. The film takes on a surreal flavour with several musical interludes (one delightfully recalling “Singin’ in the rain” as Yehia and Amr celebrate winning the Silver Bear award at Berlin). Chahine applies his signature energy to the film - an appealing mix of whimsy, satire and barbed attacks on the political and social situation in his beloved homeland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Youssef Chahine, Paris Classics, Misr International Films and La Sept Cinema
